intro: Oncidium constrictum f. castaneum, commonly known as the chestnut orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, clustered inflorescences that bear showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are long, narrow, and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and efficient water retention. The orchid thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and good air circulation for optimal growth.
